segment.source: Run the Desktop Converter App to convert a Windows desktop application (like Win32, WPF, and Windows Forms) to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: Run the Desktop Converter App to convert a Windows desktop application (like Win32, WPF, and Windows Forms) to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: Desktop App Converter Preview (Project Centennial)
segment.target: Desktop App Converter Preview (Project Centennial)

segment.source: Desktop App Converter Preview (Project Centennial)
segment.target: Desktop App Converter Preview (Project Centennial)

segment.source: Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.

segment.source: Get the Desktop App Converter.
segment.target: Get the Desktop App Converter.

segment.source: Desktop App Converter is a pre-release tool that enables you to bring your existing desktop apps written for .NET 4.6.1 or Win32 to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
segment.target: Desktop App Converter is a pre-release tool that enables you to bring your existing desktop apps written for .NET 4.6.1 or Win32 to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

segment.source: You can run your desktop installers through the converter in an unattended (silent) mode and obtain an AppX package that you can install by using the Add-AppxPackage PowerShell cmdlet on your development machine.
segment.target: You can run your desktop installers through the converter in an unattended (silent) mode and obtain an AppX package that you can install by using the Add-AppxPackage PowerShell cmdlet on your development machine.

segment.source: The converter runs the desktop installer in an isolated Windows environment using a clean base image provided as part of the converter download.
segment.target: The converter runs the desktop installer in an isolated Windows environment using a clean base image provided as part of the converter download.

segment.source: It captures any registry and file system I/O made by the desktop installer and packages it as part of the output.
segment.target: It captures any registry and file system I/O made by the desktop installer and packages it as part of the output.

segment.source: The converter outputs an AppX with package identity and the ability to call a vast range of WinRT APIs.
segment.target: The converter outputs an AppX with package identity and the ability to call a vast range of WinRT APIs.

segment.source: What's new
segment.target: What's new

segment.source: This section outlines changes between versions of the Desktop App Converter.
segment.target: This section outlines changes between versions of the Desktop App Converter.

segment.source: Added support for generating x86 appx packages on AMD64 host machines running the converter.
segment.target: Added support for generating x86 appx packages on AMD64 host machines running the converter.

segment.source: Reduced disk space usage by removing any previously expanded base images.
segment.target: Reduced disk space usage by removing any previously expanded base images.

segment.source: Added support for cleaning up temporary files and any unnecessary base images.
segment.target: Added support for cleaning up temporary files and any unnecessary base images.

segment.source: Improved support for detecting file type and protocol associations.
segment.target: Improved support for detecting file type and protocol associations.

segment.source: Improved logic to detect the AppExecutable property for a large set of apps.
segment.target: Improved logic to detect the AppExecutable property for a large set of apps.

segment.source: Added support for providing additional –InstallerArguments for MSI based installers.
segment.target: Added support for providing additional –InstallerArguments for MSI based installers.

segment.source: Bug fixes for any PathTooLongException errors during the conversion process.
segment.target: Bug fixes for any PathTooLongException errors during the conversion process.

segment.source: Restored support for Pro edition of Windows.
segment.target: Restored support for Pro edition of Windows.

segment.source: Converter flag now enables Windows Containers feature and handles base image expansion.
segment.target: Converter flag now enables Windows Containers feature and handles base image expansion.

segment.source: Run the following from an elevated PowerShell prompt to do one time setup:
segment.target: Run the following from an elevated PowerShell prompt to do one time setup:

segment.source: Added auto-detection of app install path and moving application root outside of VFS to reduce any unnecessary file system redirections at runtime.
segment.target: Added auto-detection of app install path and moving application root outside of VFS to reduce any unnecessary file system redirections at runtime.

segment.source: Added auto-detection of the expanded base image as part of the conversion process.
segment.target: Added auto-detection of the expanded base image as part of the conversion process.

segment.source: Added auto-detection for file type associations and protocols.
segment.target: Added auto-detection for file type associations and protocols.

segment.source: Improved logic to detect Start Menu shortcut.
segment.target: Improved logic to detect Start Menu shortcut.

segment.source: Improved file system filtering to retain app installed MUI files.
segment.target: Improved file system filtering to retain app installed MUI files.

segment.source: Updated the minimum supported desktop version (10.0.14342.0) for Project Centennial in the manifest.
segment.target: Updated the minimum supported desktop version (10.0.14342.0) for Project Centennial in the manifest.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.target: Supported operating system

segment.source: Windows 10 Anniversary Update Enterprise edition preview (Build 10.0.14342.0 and later)
segment.target: Windows 10 Anniversary Update Enterprise edition preview (Build 10.0.14342.0 and later)

segment.target: Required hardware configuration

segment.target: Your computer must have the following minimum capabilities:

segment.target: 64 bit (x64) processor

segment.target: Hardware-assisted virtualization

segment.target: Second Level Address Translation (SLAT)

segment.source: Set up the Desktop App Converter
segment.target: Set up the Desktop App Converter

segment.source: Desktop App Converter relies on Windows 10 features that are flighted as part of the Windows Insider Preview builds.
segment.target: Desktop App Converter relies on Windows 10 features that are flighted as part of the Windows Insider Preview builds.

segment.source: Make sure that you're on the latest build to utilize the converter.
segment.target: Make sure that you're on the latest build to utilize the converter.

segment.source: Ensure that you have the latest Windows 10 Insider Preview OS – Enterprise or Pro edition (http://insider.windows.com).
segment.target: Ensure that you have the latest Windows 10 Insider Preview OS – Enterprise or Pro edition (http://insider.windows.com).

segment.source: Download the DesktopAppConverter.zip and the base image .wim file that matches your Insider Preview build (http://aka.ms/converter).
segment.target: Download the DesktopAppConverter.zip and the base image .wim file that matches your Insider Preview build (http://aka.ms/converter).

segment.source: Extract the DesktopAppConverter.zip to a local folder.
segment.target: Extract the DesktopAppConverter.zip to a local folder.

segment.source: From an admin PowerShell window:
segment.target: From an admin PowerShell window:

segment.source: Run the following command from an admin PowerShell window to setup the converter:
segment.target: Run the following command from an admin PowerShell window to setup the converter:

segment.source: If running the previous command prompts you to reboot, restart your machine and run the command again.
segment.target: If running the previous command prompts you to reboot, restart your machine and run the command again.

segment.source: Run the Desktop App Converter
segment.target: Run the Desktop App Converter

segment.source: Desktop App Converter has two entry points: PowerShell and Command Shell.
segment.target: Desktop App Converter has two entry points: PowerShell and Command Shell.

segment.source: You can use either of these entry points to start the conversion process.
segment.target: You can use either of these entry points to start the conversion process.

segment.source: Usage
segment.target: Usage

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: The following example shows how to convert a desktop app named MyApp by publisher_name to a UWP package (AppX).
segment.target: The following example shows how to convert a desktop app named MyApp by publisher_name to a UWP package (AppX).

segment.source: From an admin PowerShell window, run the following command:
segment.target: From an admin PowerShell window, run the following command:

segment.source: Deploy your converted AppX
segment.target: Deploy your converted AppX

segment.source: Use the Add-AppxPackage cmdlet in PowerShell to deploy a signed app package (.appx) to a user account.
segment.target: Use the Add-AppxPackage cmdlet in PowerShell to deploy a signed app package (.appx) to a user account.

segment.source: To sign your .appx package, refer to the following section, "Signing your .Appx Package".
segment.target: To sign your .appx package, refer to the following section, "Signing your .Appx Package".

segment.source: Also, you can include the Register parameter of the cmdlet to install from a folder of unpackaged files during the development process.
segment.target: Also, you can include the Register parameter of the cmdlet to install from a folder of unpackaged files during the development process.

segment.source: For more info, see Deploy and debug your converted UWP app.
segment.target: For more info, see Deploy and debug your converted UWP app.

segment.source: Sign your .Appx Package
segment.target: Sign your .Appx Package

segment.source: The Add-AppxPackage cmdlet requires that the application package (.appx) being deployed must be signed.
segment.target: The Add-AppxPackage cmdlet requires that the application package (.appx) being deployed must be signed.

segment.source: Use SignTool.exe, which ships in the Microsoft Windows 10 SDK, to sign the .appx package.
segment.target: Use SignTool.exe, which ships in the Microsoft Windows 10 SDK, to sign the .appx package.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Note: When you run MakeCert.exe and you're asked to enter a password, select None.
segment.target: Note: When you run MakeCert.exe and you're asked to enter a password, select None.

segment.source: For more info on certificates and signing, see:
segment.target: For more info on certificates and signing, see:

segment.source: How to: Create Temporary Certificates for Use During Development
segment.target: How to: Create Temporary Certificates for Use During Development

segment.source: SignTool
segment.target: SignTool

segment.source: SignTool.exe (Sign Tool)
segment.target: SignTool.exe (Sign Tool)

segment.source: Caveats
segment.target: Caveats

segment.source: The Windows 10 build on the host machine must match the base image that you obtained as part of the Desktop App Converter download.
segment.target: The Windows 10 build on the host machine must match the base image that you obtained as part of the Desktop App Converter download.

segment.source: Ensure that the desktop installer is in an independent directory, because the converter copies all of the directory's content to the isolated Windows environment.
segment.target: Ensure that the desktop installer is in an independent directory, because the converter copies all of the directory's content to the isolated Windows environment.

segment.source: Currently, the Desktop App Converter supports running the conversion process on a 64-bit operating system only.
segment.target: Currently, the Desktop App Converter supports running the conversion process on a 64-bit operating system only.

segment.source: You can deploy the converted .appx packages to a 64-bit (x64) OS only.
segment.target: You can deploy the converted .appx packages to a 64-bit (x64) OS only.

segment.source: Desktop App Converter requires the desktop installer to run under unattended mode.
segment.target: Desktop App Converter requires the desktop installer to run under unattended mode.

segment.source: Ensure that you pass the silent flag for your installer to the converter by using the -InstallerArguments parameter.
segment.target: Ensure that you pass the silent flag for your installer to the converter by using the -InstallerArguments parameter.

segment.source: Publishing public SxS Fusion assemblies won't work.
segment.target: Publishing public SxS Fusion assemblies won't work.

segment.source: During install, an application can publish public side-by-side Fusion assemblies, accessible to any other process.
segment.target: During install, an application can publish public side-by-side Fusion assemblies, accessible to any other process.

segment.source: During process activation context creation, these assemblies are retrieved by a system process named CSRSS.exe.
segment.target: During process activation context creation, these assemblies are retrieved by a system process named CSRSS.exe.

segment.source: When this is done for a Centennial process, activation context creation and module loading of these assemblies will fail.
segment.target: When this is done for a Centennial process, activation context creation and module loading of these assemblies will fail.

segment.source: Inbox assemblies, like ComCtl, are shipped with the OS, so taking a dependency on them from Centennial processes is safe.
segment.target: Inbox assemblies, like ComCtl, are shipped with the OS, so taking a dependency on them from Centennial processes is safe.

segment.source: The SxS Fusion assemblies are registered in the following locations:
segment.target: The SxS Fusion assemblies are registered in the following locations:

segment.source: Registry:
segment.target: Registry:

segment.source: File System: %windir%SideBySide
segment.target: File System: %windir%SideBySide

segment.source: Known issues
segment.target: Known issues

segment.source: If you receive a Windows Insider flight on a developer machine that previously had the Desktop App Converter Preview installed, you may receive the error when you setup the new base image.
segment.target: If you receive a Windows Insider flight on a developer machine that previously had the Desktop App Converter Preview installed, you may receive the error when you setup the new base image.

segment.source: As a workaround, run the command from an elevated command prompt, then reboot your machine.
segment.target: As a workaround, run the command from an elevated command prompt, then reboot your machine.

segment.source: A .NET app compiled with "AnyCPU" build option will fail to install if the main executable or any of the dependencies were placed under "Program Files" or "Windows\System32".
segment.target: A .NET app compiled with "AnyCPU" build option will fail to install if the main executable or any of the dependencies were placed under "Program Files" or "Windows\System32".

segment.source: As a workaround, please use your architecture specific desktop installer (32 bit or 64 bit) to successfully generate an AppX package.
segment.target: As a workaround, please use your architecture specific desktop installer (32 bit or 64 bit) to successfully generate an AppX package.

segment.source: Telemetry from Desktop App Converter
segment.target: Telemetry from Desktop App Converter

segment.source: Desktop App Converter may collect information about you and your use of the software and send this info to Microsoft.
segment.target: Desktop App Converter may collect information about you and your use of the software and send this info to Microsoft.

segment.source: You can learn more about Microsoft's data collection and use in the product documentation and in the Microsoft Privacy Statement.
segment.target: You can learn more about Microsoft's data collection and use in the product documentation and in the Microsoft Privacy Statement.

segment.source: You agree to comply with all applicable provisions of the Microsoft Privacy Statement.
segment.target: You agree to comply with all applicable provisions of the Microsoft Privacy Statement.

segment.source: By default, telemetry will be enabled for the Desktop App Converter.
segment.target: By default, telemetry will be enabled for the Desktop App Converter.

segment.source: Add the following registry key to configure telemetry to a desired setting:
segment.target: Add the following registry key to configure telemetry to a desired setting:

segment.source: Add or edit the DisableTelemetry value by using a DWORD set to 1.
segment.target: Add or edit the DisableTelemetry value by using a DWORD set to 1.

segment.source: To enable telemetry, remove the key or set the value to 0.
segment.target: To enable telemetry, remove the key or set the value to 0.

segment.source: Desktop App Converter usage
segment.target: Desktop App Converter usage

segment.target: Here's a list of parameters to the Desktop App Converter.

segment.source: You can also view this list in the Windows Powershell window by running the following command:
segment.target: You can also view this list in the Windows Powershell window by running the following command:

segment.source: Setup Parameters
segment.target: Setup Parameters

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Runs DesktopAppConverter in setup mode.
segment.target: Runs DesktopAppConverter in setup mode.

segment.source: Setup mode supports expanding a provided base image.
segment.target: Setup mode supports expanding a provided base image.

segment.source: Full path to an unexpanded base image.
segment.target: Full path to an unexpanded base image.

segment.source: This parameter is required if -Setup is specified.
segment.target: This parameter is required if -Setup is specified.

segment.source: [optional]
segment.target: [optional]

segment.source: Specifies a log file.
segment.target: Specifies a log file.

segment.source: If omitted, a log file temporary location will be created.
segment.target: If omitted, a log file temporary location will be created.

segment.source: [optional]
segment.target: [optional]

segment.source: Prefix value to be used for the Nat instance.
segment.target: Prefix value to be used for the Nat instance.

segment.source: Typically, you would want to change this only if your host machine is attached to the same subnet range as the converter's NetNat.
segment.target: Typically, you would want to change this only if your host machine is attached to the same subnet range as the converter's NetNat.

segment.source: You can query the current converter NetNat config by using the Get-NetNat cmdlet.
segment.target: You can query the current converter NetNat config by using the Get-NetNat cmdlet.

segment.source: Don't prompt for reboot when running setup (reboot is required to enable the container feature).
segment.target: Don't prompt for reboot when running setup (reboot is required to enable the container feature).

segment.source: Conversion Parameters
segment.target: Conversion Parameters

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: The path to the installer for your application - must be able to run unattended/silently
segment.target: The path to the installer for your application - must be able to run unattended/silently

segment.source: [optional]
segment.target: [optional]

segment.source: A comma-separated list or string of arguments to force your installer to run unattended/silently.
segment.target: A comma-separated list or string of arguments to force your installer to run unattended/silently.

segment.source: This parameter is optional if your installer is an msi.
segment.target: This parameter is optional if your installer is an msi.

segment.source: To get a log from your installer, supply the logging argument for the installer here and use the path , which is a token that the converter replaces with the appropriate path.
segment.target: To get a log from your installer, supply the logging argument for the installer here and use the path , which is a token that the converter replaces with the appropriate path.

segment.source: NOTE: The unattended/silent flags and log arguments will vary between installer technologies.
segment.target: NOTE: The unattended/silent flags and log arguments will vary between installer technologies.

segment.source: An example usage for this parameter: Another example that doesn't produce a log file may look like: Again, you must literally direct any logs to the token path if you want the converter to capture it and put it in the final log folder.
segment.target: An example usage for this parameter: Another example that doesn't produce a log file may look like: Again, you must literally direct any logs to the token path if you want the converter to capture it and put it in the final log folder.

segment.source: [optional]
segment.target: [optional]

segment.source: A comma-separated list of exit codes that indicate your installer ran successfully (for example: 0, 1234, 5678).
segment.target: A comma-separated list of exit codes that indicate your installer ran successfully (for example: 0, 1234, 5678).

segment.source: By default this is 0 for non-msi, and 0, 1641, 3010 for msi.
segment.target: By default this is 0 for non-msi, and 0, 1641, 3010 for msi.

segment.source: The desired destination for the converter's appx output - DesktopAppConverter can create this location if it doesn't already exist.
segment.target: The desired destination for the converter's appx output - DesktopAppConverter can create this location if it doesn't already exist.

segment.target: The full path to your application's main executable if it were to be installed (it doesn't have to be), for example, "C:\Program Files (x86)\MyApp\MyApp.exe".

segment.target: [optional]

segment.target: A comma-separated list of file types which the application will be associated with (eg.

segment.source: ".txt, .doc", without the quotes).

segment.target: [optional]

segment.target: Specifies a value to set Application Id to in the appx manifest.

segment.source: Cleanup Parameters
segment.target: Cleanup Parameters

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Runs cleanup for the DesktopAppConverter artifacts.
segment.target: Runs cleanup for the DesktopAppConverter artifacts.

segment.source: There are 3 valid options for the Cleanup mode.
segment.target: There are 3 valid options for the Cleanup mode.

segment.source: Deletes all expanded base images, removes any temporary converter files, removes the container network, and disables the optional Windows feature, Containers.
segment.target: Deletes all expanded base images, removes any temporary converter files, removes the container network, and disables the optional Windows feature, Containers.

segment.source: Removes all the temporary converter files.
segment.target: Removes all the temporary converter files.

segment.source: Deletes all the expanded base images installed on your host machine.
segment.target: Deletes all the expanded base images installed on your host machine.

segment.source: x86 Package Parameters
segment.target: x86 Package Parameters

segment.source: The Desktop App Converter Preview now supports creation of x86 app packages that you can install and run on both x86 and amd64 machines.
segment.target: The Desktop App Converter Preview now supports creation of x86 app packages that you can install and run on both x86 and amd64 machines.

segment.source: Note the Desktop App Converter still needs to run on an AMD64 machine to perform a successful conversion.
segment.target: Note the Desktop App Converter still needs to run on an AMD64 machine to perform a successful conversion.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Generates a 32-bit package that can install and run on both a 32-bit and 64-bit host OS.
segment.target: Generates a 32-bit package that can install and run on both a 32-bit and 64-bit host OS.

segment.source: By default, converter attempts to detect package architecture from app’s main executable or defaults to 64-bit if no exe is found.
segment.target: By default, converter attempts to detect package architecture from app’s main executable or defaults to 64-bit if no exe is found.
